findings.lower_chest: Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. There is redemonstration of a calcified pleural plaque along the left hemidiaphragm, indicative of prior asbestos exposure.

abdominal.hepatobiliary: The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout with no evidence of focal lesions or intrahepatic/extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The gallbladder is within normal limits.
abdominal.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
abdominal.spleen: Normal size and attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions.
abdominal.urinary: The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram, no evidence of focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis.
abdominal.gastrointestinal: Diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon noted with evidence of wall thickening and fat stranding consistent with inflammation. A rim enhancing fluid collection compatible with an abscess measures 1.2 x 0.9 x 1.3 cm.
abdominal.pelvis: No free fluid in the pelvis.
abdominal.reproductive_organs: Patient is status post radical prostatectomy.
abdominal.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.

findings.soft_tissues: Abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.
